text:
Premier League
Liverpool: Is Lallana going to China?
Reds midfielder Adam Lallana could leave England for the Chinese league. Little used by Jurgen Klopp, the 31-year-old could get back to Asia in January.
04 Nov 2019, 12:40 by Mourad Bennis



After a season that has punctuated by a continuation in the last days, Monaco will have to rebuild a stronger team to better figure in Ligue 1.Icon Sport



Benjamin LecomteIcon Sport



Djibril Sidib√©Icon Sport



Kamil GlikIcon Sport



JemersonIcon Sport



Fod√© Ballo-Tour√©Icon Sport



Cesc FabregasIcon Sport



Nacer ChadliIcon Sport



Gelson MartinsIcon Sport



Aleksandr GolovinIcon Sport



Rony LopesIcon Sport



FalcaoIcon Sport

Monaco: the possible eleven of the season




Arrived in Liverpool in July 2014 (from Southampton against the sum of 28 million), the English creative world Adam Lallana should pack for the Chinese championship in January.




Lallana, next take of the Chinese league?




Adam Lallana + 12 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

English midfielder Adam Lallana, now 31, could leave the Reds. Lacking time in Liverpool, Lallana would be on the verge of joining the Chinese league.
But the MLS would also learn about his case, according to the Telegraph. Mined by several injuries over the months, Lallana could not express his talent in Liverpool. With a good technique, Lallana could make the happiness of the Chinese or North American championship in January.
